name: Generator Sizing & Load Analysis
description: Undersized generators can't handle your loads. Oversized generators waste money on purchase and fuel. Solomon Electric's licensed electricians provide professional generator sizing and load analysis for South Florida homes and businesses—calculating exactly what capacity you need based on your essential loads, growth plans, and usage patterns.
warningSignsHeading: Do You Need Generator Sizing & Load Analysis? Common Warning Signs
warningSignsSubheading: Proper sizing ensures reliable backup without wasted investment.

problems.title: Don't Know What Size to Buy
problems.description: Generator marketing can be confusing. Professional load analysis determines exactly what capacity your home or business needs.

problems.title: Want to Run AC on Generator
problems.description: Air conditioning has large startup loads. Sizing must account for both running load and motor starting current to avoid overloading.

problems.title: Current Generator Struggles
problems.description: If your existing generator overloads or won't start equipment, it may be undersized. We analyze loads to determine if upgrade is needed.

problems.title: Planning New Generator Purchase
problems.description: Before investing in a generator system, know exactly what size you need. Avoid undersizing disappointment or oversizing waste. Professional sizing protects your investment.

problems.title: Business Growth Plans
problems.description: Facilities planning to add equipment or expand should size generators for future loads, not just current needs.

problems.title: Essential Loads Only vs. Whole-House
problems.description: Understanding the significant cost difference between essential-load backup and whole-house backup helps budget appropriately.

processHeading: What to Expect During Generator Sizing & Load Analysis

process.title: Load Inventory
process.description: We document all electrical loads in your home or facility—HVAC, appliances, equipment—with their power requirements.

process.title: Priority Classification
process.description: We classify loads as essential (must have power), optional (nice to have), or excluded (not worth generator capacity).

process.title: Starting Load Calculations
process.description: Motors (AC compressors, well pumps) draw 3-6x running current when starting. We calculate peak starting loads to size appropriately.

process.title: Load Sequencing
process.description: For larger systems, sequencing starts can reduce required generator size. We assess whether load management makes sense.

process.title: Size Recommendation
process.description: We recommend generator capacity with appropriate safety margin, explain tradeoffs, and discuss fuel type and brand options.

benefitsHeading: Advantages of Professional Generator Sizing & Load Analysis

benefits.title: Right-Sized Investment
benefits.description: Don't pay for capacity you won't use. Don't suffer with undersized backup. Professional sizing matches generator to actual needs.

benefits.title: Reliable Operation
benefits.description: Properly sized generators run within their capacity, providing reliable power without overloading or struggling.

benefits.title: Fuel Efficiency
benefits.description: Oversized generators running at low load waste fuel and may not operate properly. Right-sizing improves efficiency.

benefits.title: Future-Ready
benefits.description: We factor in planned additions—EV charger, pool pump, home addition—so your generator works today and tomorrow.

faqs.question: How do you calculate generator size?
faqs.answer: We inventory all loads requiring backup, determine their running power (watts), calculate starting power for motors (3-6x running), account for future additions, and add safety margin. The result is minimum recommended capacity.

faqs.question: What size generator do I need for my home?
faqs.answer: It varies widely. A small home backing up only essentials (refrigerator, some lights, outlets) might need 10-12 kW. Running central AC typically requires 18-24 kW or larger. Whole-house backup for larger homes may need 30-48 kW. Load analysis determines your specific needs.

faqs.question: Can I run my central AC on a generator?
faqs.answer: Yes, with adequate sizing. A 3-ton AC needs roughly 3-4 kW running but 8-12 kW to start. The generator must handle starting surge plus other running loads. We calculate whether your AC can run with other priorities.

faqs.question: What's the difference between running and starting watts?
faqs.answer: Running watts are continuous load when equipment operates. Starting watts are the brief surge when motors start—typically 3-6x running watts. Generators must handle peak starting loads plus running loads of already-operating equipment.

faqs.question: Should I size for future needs?
faqs.answer: If you're planning additions—EV charger, pool, expanding your home—sizing for future loads costs less than upgrading later. We help you plan appropriate capacity for both current and planned needs.

faqs.question: What if I can only afford a smaller generator?
faqs.answer: Strategic load selection can significantly reduce required size. Perhaps you back up a window AC unit instead of central, or prioritize refrigerator and lights while skipping high-draw items. We help you prioritize effectively.

faqs.question: Is your sizing affiliated with a specific brand?
faqs.answer: No. We provide brand-neutral sizing based on your loads. Once you know required capacity, you can compare brands for features and pricing. We can recommend brands but our sizing isn't designed to sell any particular brand.

faqs.question: How does fuel type affect sizing?
faqs.answer: Generator output varies slightly by fuel. Natural gas typically provides 85-90% of rated output vs. propane. Diesel units have different sizing curves. We specify appropriate capacity for your chosen fuel type.

seoContent.heading: Generator Sizing & Load Analysis in South Florida
seoContent.body: Undersized generators can't handle your loads. Oversized generators waste money. Solomon Electric provides professional generator sizing throughout {county} and Broward counties—calculating exactly what capacity your home or business needs for reliable backup power. Our licensed electricians perform a complete load calculation before any panel work, ensuring your new panel meets current NEC requirements and has room for future expansion. We use copper bus bars, properly torqued connections, and AFCI/GFCI breakers where required by Florida Building Code.

seoContent.heading: Right-Size Your Generator Investment in Miami
seoContent.body: Don't guess at generator size. Professional load analysis inventories your essential loads, calculates motor starting requirements, and recommends appropriate capacity with safety margin. Know exactly what you need before investing thousands in backup power. South Florida's heat and humidity accelerate corrosion inside electrical panels. We inspect for oxidized bus bars, loose connections, and thermal damage that compromise safety. Every panel we install includes proper weather sealing rated for coastal environments.

seoContent.heading: Residential Generator Sizing for South Florida Homes
seoContent.body: Every home is different. We analyze your specific loads—HVAC size, well pump, appliances, and priorities—to determine the right generator for your family's needs. Whether you want essential-only backup or whole-house power, we size appropriately. Insurance companies increasingly require panel upgrades for policy renewals. Our electricians provide documented before-and-after reports that satisfy insurance requirements, and we coordinate directly with your insurer when needed.

seoContent.heading: Serving South Florida Properly
seoContent.body: Solomon Electric provides generator sizing and load analysis throughout {cityName} and surrounding communities. Get expert sizing before your generator purchase—know exactly what you need. Modern electrical demands—EV chargers, home offices, pool equipment, smart home systems—require more capacity than panels installed even 15 years ago. We future-proof your installation with 20-30% additional capacity beyond your current needs.
